intro: Nesaea heptamera var. bullockii, commonly known as the Bullock's nesaea, is a rare and specialized plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its flowers are small and white, often clustered in dense, spherical heads. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species requiring conservation efforts.
